bibl.title: Letter from John B. Hartzell to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1940

div1.p: Hartzell informs Hench that he cannot find the information Hench requested on Dean, and suggests that he write to Grand Rapids.

div1.head: Letter from John B. Hartzell to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1940
div1.opener:
DR. JOHN B. HARTZELL
7815 JEFFERSON AVENUE, EAST
DETROIT
September 5, 1940
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
In looking up William H. Dean and the Memorial
Bridge, the officials of the City of Detroit were able to
give me no information whatever. The enclosed information
was secured from the Burton Department of the Detroit
Public Library, and I am sending it on to you. I suggest
you write Dr. A. R. Hufford or Dr. W. P. L. McBride of
Grand Rapids and they can probably secure a picture for you.

I hope this helps you in obtaining the information
you desire.
